prompt:
Complete this task using ONLY what you see. If you get stuck, say exactly where and why. Do NOT guess or make up UI elements that aren't visible.

Your job is to identify WHERE users get stuck, not to be clever.

Task: "Edit the node title"

Answer in JSON format:
{
  "can_complete": true or false,
  "steps": [
    {"target": "precise element description with location", "confidence": "certain/likely/guessing", "why": "reasoning"}
  ],
  "stuck_at_step": null or step number,
  "why_stuck": "what information is missing",
  "wrong_turns": ["things you almost clicked by mistake"],
  "recovery_possible": "if you click wrong thing, can you undo?"
}

steps.target: The text input field labeled 'Title' containing 'New Note' in the right panel
steps.why: This is clearly the title field for the node, located at the top of the properties panel on the right side. It currently shows 'New Note' and can be edited by clicking on it.

steps.target: Click inside the title input field and modify the text
steps.why: Once clicked, the field becomes editable and the user can type a new title to replace 'New Note'

wrong_turns: The 'New Note' text visible on the canvas node itself - this appears to be a label/display of the node rather than an editable field
The 'Content' text area below which says 'Write your note here...' - this is for note content, not the title
response.recovery_possible: Yes, if the wrong field is clicked, you can simply click away or press Escape to deselect and try again with the correct Title field
